channel.title: Problem with cache download PI client
channel.description:
Hey everyone, I'm running a PI client, which downloads my cache.zip perfectly (at least it's running from 0 to 100%, then says finished), but doesn't extract it properly. It download the cache.zip to C:\mycache\cache.zip. It also creates the folder C:\mycache\mycache\, which contains the actual cache! But my client does not read it. How do I fix this? Thanks!
Radar

item.title: Problem with cache download PI client
item.dc:creator: @STOOPID STOOPID
item.description:
@STOOPID wrote:

k0 twin:

It’s no problem dude happens to people all the time =)

Sorry for the HUGE grave-dig, but you helped me too!
I had the same problem xD

Read full topic

item.source: Problem with cache download PI client

item.title: Problem with cache download PI client
item.dc:creator: @Radars Radars
item.description:
@Radars wrote:

k0 twin:

I assume you’re talking about a webclient, and first of all you don’t wan’t to zip your cache folder, you want to zip all of its contents. So it should be C:/mycache/ and then all of the contents of the cache, not a zip file.

I’m a retard, you fixed it, tyvm.

Read full topic
item.source: Problem with cache download PI client
